stadium.name: The Prismatic Pavilion
stadium.description: A massive, permanent, open-air fairground pavilion built on stilts over the Starlight Lagoon. The field is a chaotic mix of colorful stage-planks, constantly surrounded by the Prismatic Troupe's performers.

stats.pregame_ritual: Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Staring at their reflection in a bucket of water until they feel 'ready'.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Staring intently at their gauntlets, as if for the first time.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Trying to start a 'slow clap' with the audience before the game has begun.

stadium.name: The Old Fort
stadium.description: The team plays within the crumbling, stone-ringed ruins of an ancient hill-fort. The 'runes' are just old, weathered carvings on the standing stones that serve as obstacles.

stats.pregame_ritual: Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Spitting into their own hand and then slapping their face with it.
Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
A toast of goat's milk to the health of their rivals.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.

preGame:
Hello, hello, hello, sports fans, ghouls, and glorious gladiators! This is Nok the Corrupter coming to you live from the Prismatic Pavilion, and boy howdy, do we have a doozy for you tonight! We are deep in the heart of the Losers Bracket, where the air is thick with the scent of desperation and the salt spray of the Starlight Lagoon! It‚Äôs Game Two of this Best of 3 series, and the stakes couldn't be higher! The Starlight Bazaar Bizarres are leading 1-0 after that opening thrashing, and they‚Äôre looking to close the curtains on the Kerlauger Runeguard right here in front of their home crowd! 

Speaking of the home crowd, Kython‚Äôs Prismatic Troupe is out in full force, and the Pavilion is swaying on its stilts! I saw Gagliano Tallbott earlier whispering a real knee-slapper to the leather troll head to 'loosen it up'‚ÄîI just hope the ball doesn't die of laughter before it hits the basket! Meanwhile, over in the Runeguard camp, they‚Äôre looking as grim as a tax collector at a funeral. Harilda Sigsmond is leading the squad in a chant that‚Äôs getting louder by the second, probably trying to drown out the sound of their own heartbeats! 

This stadium is a real trip, folks! Between the 'Lagoon Splashes' soaking the players and the 'Unstable Footing' of these stage-planks, it‚Äôs a wonder anyone can stand, let alone fight! I saw Lashondra Niehaus getting a teammate to punch her in the shoulder just to get the blood flowing‚Äîthat‚Äôs the kind of grit we love here in Osterra! Will the Bizarres dance their way to the next round, or will the Runeguard find the runes of victory in the mud? Grab your grog and secure your helmets, because it‚Äôs time for Tuesday Night Trollball! üèüÔ∏è‚ú®üí•
postGame:
Holy cow, what a turnaround! I hope you didn't bet your last gold piece on a sweep, because the Kerlauger Runeguard just threw a massive wrench into the Bizarres' victory parade! In a defensive struggle that would make a stone golem weep with joy, the Runeguard have shut out the circus crew 2-0! We are headed to a Game Three, folks! The series is tied, the blood is spilled, and the drama is at an all-time high! It was a masterpiece of mayhem under the bright lights of the Prismatic Pavilion!

The match started with a frenzy as Milo Nelie snatched the ball for the Bizarres, but the 'heroes' of the White Ravens weren't having any of it! Lashondra Niehaus, clearly fueled by that pre-game shoulder punch, absolutely leveled Demp Chet right out of the gate! The crunch of bone against the colorful stage-planks was music to my ears, sending Chet straight to the healer‚Äôs tent! It was a statement hit that set the tone for a very long, very painful night for the home team.

The Bizarres tried to keep their theatrical poses going, but Gurney Fadiman decided to cut the performance short by tackling Pompei Hephzipa into the next dimension! Another injury for the Bizarres! Kython‚Äôs troupe was looking more like a medical ward than a circus. Despite the chaos, the Runeguard couldn't quite find the basket early on, with Johnna Beetner and Lon Gabriell missing wild shots that sailed into the lagoon. I haven't seen this many splashes since Sir Tanos tried to wash his 'cursed' laundry!

Possession was bouncing around like a panicked rabbit! We saw interceptions from Pompei Hephzipa and Shepperd Trefler, as both teams struggled with the 'Unstable Footing' of the pavilion. Every time the Bizarres tried to mount an offensive, the Runeguard defense was there like a brick wall. Gurney Fadiman wasn't finished with his rampage, either‚Äîhe sent Melesa Zelten to the dirt with a tackle that probably shook the stilts holding up the entire stadium!

As we headed into halftime, the score was still a goose egg for both sides. Healer Eal Caundra and Essa Pattie were working overtime, patching up mangled limbs and bruised egos. You could tell the alcohol tolerance of these players was being tested by the sheer amount of 'magic' being pumped into them just to keep them standing! The atmosphere was tense, the fans were restless, and I was loving every second of the stalemate!

The second half saw the Bizarres' luck run as thin as Chairman Farno‚Äôs patience! Interceptions were the name of the game, with Gurney Fadiman snatching a pass right out of the air. The Bizarres tried to retaliate when Pompei Hephzipa finally caught Gurney with a tackle that sent him to the sidelines, but the momentum was already shifting toward the visitors. It was a gritty, dirty battle that made the 'noble' deeds of the realm look like a puppet show.

Then, the moment that defined the match! Benjie Foulk, who I saw patting beasts of burden for luck earlier, scooped up the ball deep in Home Field territory! The crowd went silent as Harilda Sigsmond stepped up. With the precision of an assassin and the power of a catapult, Sigsmond unleashed a shoot that hit the basket with a satisfying thud! That‚Äôs 2 points for the Runeguard! The silence in the Prismatic Pavilion was so thick you could carve it with a scimitar!

The Bizarres tried a desperate last-minute push, but the Runeguard were smelling blood. Lon Gabriell decided to put an exclamation point on the victory by tackling Aggri Cookie into the planks, adding another injury to the Bizarres' long list for the night. Bush Heiner tried to run, but she was smothered by a sea of green and grey. The 'heroes' of the bazaar were left looking like they'd spent the night in a meat grinder!

When the final horn sounded, the scoreboard read 2-0 in favor of the Runeguard! They came into the lion's den‚Äîor the clown's tent, I suppose‚Äîand pitched a perfect shutout! The Bizarres looked utterly demoralized, their fancy broadswords and theatrical poses failing them when the hitting got heavy. It just goes to show that you can have all the glitter in the world, but it won't stop a Kerlauger boot to the ribs!

So, we‚Äôve got ourselves a real series now, folks! Game Three is going to be a bloodbath for the ages! The winner moves on, and the loser goes home to explain to their faction why they got bullied on the field! I'm Nok the Corrupter, and if you'll excuse me, I have some winnings to collect from a very grumpy casino owner! Stay brutal, Osterra, and we'll see you for the tie-breaker! üèüÔ∏èüíÄüî•
